Thinkpad Thunderbolt 3 Dock does not work correctly after replug

Hey together,

I was coming from the following thread:
https://bbs.archlinux.org/viewtopic.php?pid=1865950

After investigating a bit more, my problem seems similar, but not exactly the same. I only know until now that the LTS kernel is working perfectly fine. All other kernels I've tested yet (until 5.1.) are broken however.

This behavior started after I connected a new display via usb c. The dock has a daisy chain thunderbolt output in which the usb c is plugged to currently. After replugging the docking station, the first time sometimes it works, but most of the time it stops working. Latest the second time I replug it stops working forever. I also see an connecting icon https://ibb.co/ZcdwK6H from that point on, which does not disappear anymore. The screen however still works, but everything else the dock should give is broken. So it seems to be a problem with the daisy chaining, I will try to connect the display via display port as soon as I find time again and report back for that scenario, what I know until now is, if I connect it via HDMI on the dock it works perfectly fine. So it is definitely related to the usb c/thunderbolt outlet. The laptop we're talking about is a thinkpad t580.

Here are some outputs which hopefully already help to get more near to the problem.

Re: Thinkpad Thunderbolt 3 Dock does not work correctly after replug

@wzrdtales, just fyi, my issue turned out to be that boltd doesn't re-authorize the dock at plugin (even though I've run `boltctl enable`)  so every time I plug it in I have to re-run `boltctl authorize` and then things work.  I had different errors from you, so I'm not sure if that's your issue (you might want to try this patch too).

text: Arch LinuxHomePackagesForumsWikiBugsSecurityAURDownload * [Index](index.php) * [Rules](misc.php?action=rules) * [Search](search.php) * [Register](register.php) * [Login](login.php) You are not logged in. * Topics: [Active](search.php?action=show_recent) | [Unanswered](search.php?action=show_unanswered) * [Index](index.php) * » [Kernel & Hardware](viewforum.php?id=22) * » [Thinkpad Thunderbolt 3 Dock does not work correctly after replug](viewtopic.php?id=249553) Pages: 1 #1 [2019-09-29 10:46:47](viewtopic.php?pid=1865954#p1865954) wzrdtales Member Registered: 2017-03-14 Posts: 24 Thinkpad Thunderbolt 3 Dock does not work correctly after replug Hey together, I was coming from the following thread: https://bbs.archlinux.org/viewtopic.php?pid=1865950 After investigating a bit more, my problem seems similar, but not exactly the same. I only know until now that the LTS kernel is working perfectly fine. All other kernels I've tested yet (until 5.1.) are broken however. This behavior started after I connected a new display via usb c. The dock has a daisy chain thunderbolt output in which the usb c is plugged to currently. After replugging the docking station, the first time sometimes it works, but most of the time it stops working. Latest the second time I replug it stops working forever. I also see an connecting icon https://ibb.co/ZcdwK6H from that point on, which does not disappear anymore. The screen however still works, but everything else the dock should give is broken. So it seems to be a problem with the daisy chaining, I will try to connect the display via display port as soon as I find time again and report back for that scenario, what I know until now is, if I connect it via HDMI on the dock it works perfectly fine. So it is definitely related to the usb c/thunderbolt outlet. The laptop we're talking about is a thinkpad t580. Bus 001 Device 002: ID 5986:1141 Acer, Inc Integrated IR Camera Bus 001 Device 001: ID 1d6b:0002 Linux Foundation 2.0 root hub Last edited by wzrdtales (2019-09-30 11:46:18) Offline #2 [2019-10-06 16:59:52](viewtopic.php?pid=1866986#p1866986) nickl Member Registered: 2019-09-25 Posts: 3 Re: Thinkpad Thunderbolt 3 Dock does not work correctly after replug @wzrdtales, just fyi, my issue turned out to be that boltd doesn't re-authorize the dock at plugin (even though I've run `boltctl enable`) so every time I plug it in I have to re-run `boltctl authorize` and then things work. I had different errors from you, so I'm not sure if that's your issue (you might want to try this patch too). Offline #3 [2019-10-10 13:47:14](viewtopic.php?pid=1867716#p1867716) wzrdtales Member Registered: 2017-03-14 Posts: 24 Re: Thinkpad Thunderbolt 3 Dock does not work correctly after replug I will try with boltctl, and have a look at the patch and post it back here as soon as I am at my desk again. Offline #4 [2019-10-13 11:20:44](viewtopic.php?pid=1868220#p1868220) wzrdtales Member Registered: 2017-03-14 Posts: 24 Re: Thinkpad Thunderbolt 3 Dock does not work correctly after replug boltctl authorize ends up in this state for me: Authorization error: wrong device state: authorizing Offline #5 [2020-03-09 14:35:12](viewtopic.php?pid=1891075#p1891075) wzrdtales Member Registered: 2017-03-14 Posts: 24 Re: Thinkpad Thunderbolt 3 Dock does not work correctly after replug Anyone nows if there is any new progress or bug report on this? Since the lts was released with the newer kernels this is broken even more. After detaching from the docking station you can't even put the device into power saving mode anymore and if you attempt to do so the system will freeze and crash completely. post_text.surface_form: Hey together, I was coming from the following thread: https://bbs.archlinux.org/viewtopic.php?pid=1865950 After investigating a bit more, my problem seems similar, but not exactly the same. I only know until now that the LTS kernel is working perfectly fine. All other kernels I've tested yet (until 5.1.) are broken however. This behavior started after I connected a new display via usb c. The dock has a daisy chain thunderbolt output in which the usb c is plugged to currently. After replugging the docking station, the first time sometimes it works, but most of the time it stops working. Latest the second time I replug it stops working forever. I also see an connecting icon https://ibb.co/ZcdwK6H from that point on, which does not disappear anymore. The screen however still works, but everything else the dock should give is broken. So it seems to be a problem with the daisy chaining, I will try to connect the display via display port as soon as I find time again and report back for that scenario, what I know until now is, if I connect it via HDMI on the dock it works perfectly fine. So it is definitely related to the usb c/thunderbolt outlet. The laptop we're talking about is a thinkpad t580. @wzrdtales, just fyi, my issue turned out to be that boltd doesn't re-authorize the dock at plugin (even though I've run `boltctl enable`) so every time I plug it in I have to re-run `boltctl authorize` and then things work. I had different errors from you, so I'm not sure if that's your issue (you might want to try this patch too).
I will try with boltctl, and have a look at the patch and post it back here as soon as I am at my desk again.
boltctl authorize ends up in this state for me: Authorization error: wrong device state: authorizing

Anyone nows if there is any new progress or bug report on this? Since the lts was released with the newer kernels this is broken even more. After detaching from the docking station you can't even put the device into power saving mode anymore and if you attempt to do so the system will freeze and crash completely.
